intro: Jacquemontia menispermoides, commonly known as the purple morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed areas. Its rapid growth and climbing habit make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed.
